intro: Oxydectes campestris, commonly known as the field gentian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Oxydectes campestris is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
